intro: Pilosella banaticola, commonly known as the Banat's hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers surrounded by a ring of narrow, hairy leaves. Pilosella banaticola is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
